title: Contents
html:
Thank you for using SimpleDocs.

This documentation source is built with SimpleDocs to document SimpleDocs.

Table of Contents
type: Contents then List of Child Root Documents

title: Installation
html:
Installation

You can use SimpleDocs with a current KeystoneJS app, a custom ExpressJS app or as a standalone app.


install by command line
npm install simpledocs

There is an examples folder with ready to use Express and Standalone examples.

install by package.json 

/*include only what you need.  this is for a standalone*/

"dependencies": {
    "connect-mongo": "^0.4.1",
    "dotenv": "~0.0.3",
    "express": "3.3.x",
    "hat": "",
    "jade": "1.5.x",
    "keystone": "0.2.x",
    "mongoose": "3.8.x",
    "sanitizer": "",
    "snowpi-greeter": "0.1.x"
    "simpledocs": "0.0.x"
  },
type: Contents then List of Child Root Documents

title: Download
markdown:
NPMJS

NPM - https://www.npmjs.org/package/simpledocs

npm install simpledocs

GitHub - source   |   latest.zip  |  latest.tar.gz

git clone git@github.com:snowkeeper/simpledocs.git

title: Multiple Doc Sources Per App
markdown:
Add Multiple Documentation sources per app


You can add as many documentation sources to your app as you want. The SimpleDocs Object can be called upon itself to create a new instance.

The following example shows 2 document sources running on the same Keystone app.

var keystone = require('keystone'),
    simpledocs = require('simpledocs');

Prepare the first source

var init = {
            route: '/docs/simpledocs',
            'name': 'standalone documents',
            'brand': 'inquisive',
            'simpledocs model': 'simpledocs-documentation',
            'simpledocs model config': {
                label: 'SimpleDocs Documentation',
                path: 'simpledocs',
                singular: 'SimpleDocs Document',
                plural: 'SimpleDocs Documents',
            },
        }    
simpledocs
    .on('init',function(config) {
        /* we get the config object we pass to start */

    })
    .on('keystone',function(keystone) {
        /* add your own keystone options before mount */

    })
    .on('model',function() {
        /* add your own models and register them with keystone */

    })
    .on('routes',function() {
        /* add your own routes */

    })
    .on('complete',function() {
        /* app is configured */        

    });

Prepare the 2nd source. You can add the main configuration into the function as a config object.

var snowdocs = new simpledocs.SimpleDocs({
        route:'/docs/snowcoins',
        model:'snowcoins-docs',
        modelConfig:{
            label: 'Snowcoins Documentation',
            path: 'snowcoins-documentation',
            singular: 'Snowcoins Documentation Document',
            plural: 'Snowcoins Documentation Documents',
        }});
snowdocs
    .on('complete',function() {

    });


Start in keystone onMount

keystone.start({
    onMount: function() {
            snowdocs.start();
            simpledocs.start(init);
        }
});

Done!
links: Keystone App Example, BYO Express Example, Standalone App Example

title: BYO Express Example
markdown:
BYO Express Configuration

Configure your Express app but wait to start it until SimpleDocs has added routes.

You must provide a configuration object with mongoose and app.

This example app is provided in examples/byoexpress.js

var express = require('express'),
    mongoose = require('mongoose'),
    app = express(),
    simpledocs = require('simpledocs');

// Mongoose connection to MongoDB 
mongoose.connect('mongodb://localhost/snowcoins', function (error) {
    if (error) {
        console.log(error);
    }
});

var init = {
    standalone: false,
    app:app,
    mongoose:mongoose,
    route: '/docs/simpledocs',

    'name': 'standalone documents',
    'brand': 'inquisive',

    'simpledocs model': 'simpledocs-documentation',
    'simpledocs model config': {
        label: 'SimpleDocs Documentation',
        path: 'simpledocs',
        singular: 'SimpleDocs Document',
        plural: 'SimpleDocs Documents',
    },
}

simpledocs
    .on('init',function(config) {
        /* we get the config object we pass to start */

    })
    .on('keystone',function(keystone) {
        /* add your own keystone options before mount */
        /* you can also add  routes through keystone here */
    })
    .on('model',function() {
        /* add your own models and register them with keystone */

    })
    .on('complete',function() {
        /* simpledocs is configured */

        /*start app */
        console.log('start app on port 12111');
        app.listen(12111);
    })        
    .start(init);

title: Standalone App Example
markdown:
Standalone App


The standalone app includes user access with a greeter page.

This example app is provided in examples/standalone.js and as a standalone available for download as a zip or tar.gz.


On first install, user registration will be set to true, and new users will be given admin status. Once a new user has been registered you can turn either off.

    simpledocs.set('new user can admin',false);
    simpledocs.set('allow register',false);


Now set up your page. This is a copy of examples/standalone.js

var simpledocs = require('simpledocs');

var init = {
    standalone: true,
    theme:false,
    route: '/',
    //route: '*', /* for a single service route */
    'new user can admin':true,
    'allow register':true,
    'ssl': false,
    //'ssl key': 'key.pem',
    //'ssl cert':'cert.pem',
    //'ssl port': 12222,
    'name': 'standalone documents',
    'brand': 'inquisive',
    'mongo': 'mongodb://jackson-pollup.snowcoins.link/snowcoinslink',
    'simpledocs model': 'simpledocs-documentation',
    'simpledocs model config': {
        label: 'SimpleDocs Documentation',
        path: 'simpledocs',
        singular: 'SimpleDocs Document',
        plural: 'SimpleDocs Documents',
    },
}

simpledocs
    .on('init',function(config) {
        /* we get the config object we pass to start */

    })
    .on('keystone',function(keystone) {
        /* add your own keystone options before mount */

        /* add your own routes; the route event happens after keystone has started so we use this event instead */
        //keystone.app.get('/help',function(req,res){})
    })
    .on('model',function(keystone) {
        /* add your own models and register them with keystone */

    })
    .on('complete',function(keystone) {
        /* app is configured */
        console.log('user on ran');
    })        
    .start(init);

title: Keystone App Example
markdown:
Keystone App


Plug SimpleDocs into a Keystone app with the keystone.start() onMount event 

var keystone = require('keystone'),
    simpledocs = require('simpledocs');

...
Setup Keystone.  View `lib/start/standalone.js` for an example Keystone setup.
You can set any SimpleDoc configuration settings here.
...
simpledocs.set('theme','dark-theme')


keystone.start({
    onMount: function() {

        var init = {
            route: '/docs/simpledocs',
            'name': 'standalone documents',
            'brand': 'inquisive',
            'simpledocs model': 'simpledocs-documentation',
            'simpledocs model config': {
                label: 'SimpleDocs Documentation',
                path: 'simpledocs',
                singular: 'SimpleDocs Document',
                plural: 'SimpleDocs Documents',
            },
        }    
        simpledocs
            .on('init',function(config) {
                /* we get the config object we pass to start */

            })
            .on('model',function() {
                /* add your own models and register them with keystone */

            })
            .on('routes',function() {
                /* add your own routes */

            })
            .on('complete',function() {
                /* app is configured */


            })        
            .start(init);


        var snowdocs = new simpledocs.SimpleDocs({route:'/docs/snowcoins',model:'snowcoins-docs',modelConfig:{
            label: 'Snowcoins Documentation',
            path: 'snowcoins-documentation',
            singular: 'Snowcoins Documentation Document',
            plural: 'Snowcoins Documentation Documents',
        }});
        snowdocs
            .on('complete',function() {

            })
            .start();
    }
});

title: Options
markdown:
SimpleDocs Configuration


Configuration options can be set by calling simpledocs.set('the key','the value')
You can also pass a configuration object on simpledocs.start(Obj) to set the route and model options.

You will have access to events during setup to manage Keystone or add custom options.


route

set the route. -- will be overwritten if route is added via the init Object on simpledocs.start(init)
simpledocs.set('route','/docs/simpledocs');

simpledocs model

the name of the new/existing document model
simpledocs.set('simpledocs model','SimpleDocs');

simpledocs model config

some options for display in the Admin UI
simpledocs.set('simpledocs model config',{
        label: 'Simple Documentation',
        path: 'simple-documentation',
        singular: 'Document',
        plural: 'Simple Documents',
});

custom style

add a new stylesheet as the last styles loaded - read more
simpledocs.set('custom style','/styles/mystyle.css');

theme

add a class to body on first load - read more
simpledocs.set('theme','dark-theme');

menu collapse

set to true and only the active menu branch will be displayed. set to false and the entire menu will be displayed.
simpledocs.set('menu collapse',true);

menu single branch

set to true and only the first Child Branch of a Parent will be shown when active. set to false and every Branch of the Parent will be displayed when active. Does not apply to Root items, use menu collapse to control an entire menu tree.
simpledocs.set('menu single branch',true);

always load tree

for use with development set true and the menu is sent each time a page is requested. set false and the menu is only sent on initial page load or direct request.
simpledocs.set('always load tree',true);

homepage

the slug of the default page
simpledocs.set('homepage','contents');

wysiwyg

the Admin UI can show the html box as plain or wysiwyg
simpledocs.set('wysiwyg',false);

html height

the height of the html input box as an Integer
simpledocs.set('html height',300);

mongo

for a standalone app we need the mongoDB location or this is the default
simpledocs.set('mongo','mongodb://localhost/simple-documentation');
...
or with an ENV variable
...
MONGO_URI='mongodb://localhost/simple-documentation'

title: Style - Archived
markdown:
CSS and Stylesheet options

Bootstrap is used for the styles.

There is a light and dark theme. To use the dark theme by default:

simpledocs.set('theme','dark-theme');
Custom Stylesheet

Add your own stylesheet. It will be called last and override any default styles. Provide a full url or a link to your app public folder.
You can combine both options to attach your own theme to the body class.

simpledocs.set('custom style','/styles/mystyles.css');

Here is a copy of the dark theme. It is just colors. You can use it as a template.

/* dark theme */
body.dark-theme {
    background-color: #070F13;
    color: #B7C2C7;
}
.dark-theme pre,.dark-theme code {
    background:  #0C1D26;
    border-color:  #193947;
    color: #E9F1F5;
    overflow:auto;
}
.dark-theme .list-group-item {
    background-color: #0D1C23;
    color: #FFFCEF;
}
.dark-theme .list-group-item:hover {
    background-color: #16313D;
    color: #FFFCEF;
}
.dark-theme .list-group-item.active {
    background-color: #112630;
    color: #FFFCEF;
}
.dark-theme .list-group {
    background:  #0D1C23;
    border-color:  #142D38;
}
.dark-theme .simpledoc .carousel-indicators li{
    border-color:#FFFCEF;
}
.dark-theme .simpledoc .carousel-indicators .active {
    background-color:#FFFCEF;
}
.dark-theme #menu {
    background: #0A181E;
}
.dark-theme #menu .dropdown{
    background: #122733;
    color: #5C6F79;
}
.dark-theme #menu .dropdown.open {
    background-color: #0D1D26;
}
.dark-theme #simpledocs  .head {
    background: #0F222D;
    color: #FFFCEF;
}
.dark-theme #simpledocs  .head a{
    color: #FFFCEF;
}
.dark-theme #banner {
    background-color: #0D1C23;
}
.dark-theme #banner .banner-inside #name {
    color: #FFFCEF;
    background: #142D38;
}
.dark-theme #banner .banner-inside #title {
    color: #FFFCEF;
}
.dark-theme #home .related {
    border-color:#0D1E26;
    color: #FFFCEF;
}
.dark-theme #home .linkPager {
    border-color:#0D1E26;
    color: #FFFCEF;
}
.dark-theme #easter-egg {
    background: #142D38;
    border-color:#1D4151;
    color: #FFFCEF;
}
.dark-theme .pager li>a, .pager li>span {
    background-color: #122833;
    border-color: #173847;
}
.dark-theme .fademessage {
    background-color: #4498C2;
}

title: About
markdown:
About SimpleDocs


SimpleDocs is built with KeystoneJS, making use of the Admin UI.

The goal is a simple, single form UI to add documentation documents. It should be easy to use and simple to add multiple document sources to an existing app.

To create documents we use the KeystoneJS admin UI. There is a single form per document source and each document source is a separate collection.

To view the documents, a simple, single page app was built with ReactJS and Bootstrap.

title: Creating Documents
html:
Working in the Keystone UI

Access the Keystone Admin UI at /keystone.

Welcome to the Keystone Admin UI.

The homepage will list your documentation sources on the left.

Select a documentation source to view the list of documents.

To create a new document click on the top button "Create SimpleDocs Document".

The exact name of the button will change based on your settings.

Your current documents are listed in an ordered fashion, with Root documents first, but not grouped. We need to add that feature later.

Add, Update and Delete your documents by clicking the Title.

Your first document should be a Root document without a parent.
You will build/display a document tree under Root documents.
Root documents function as a table of contents and list all of their child documents automatically, while you provide the Header.
Your first Root document slug should be contents or match simpledocs.get('homepage').

To add a new page select the Parent Document (blank for Root) and enter a Title.
When you click you will get a full form to manage the new document.

The slug will be created for you from the title. You can edit it if you want. It will never be blank.
Your content can be HTML, Markdown or a mix of the two.
Turn the html box into a wysiwyg with snowcoins.set('wysiwyg',true);
Markdown. The link is an external site that provides and editor with side by side preview. You can copy / paste your data back and forth.
Select any related documents to provide links.
The links are shown below the content in a Related section.
Add external links separated by a space or comma.
The links are shown below the content in a Related section.
This page can show the Document Contents, a list of Child pages or both; the Document Contents then a list of Child pages.
The app will take care of ordering for you. That is a search box only. When you select an option you get another box to enter your value. The Enter Number field takes an Integer, 'append' or 'prepend'
Choose Before or After Document and the selected document will be used as our order number reference. This will not move a document to a new parent.
Don't set the order manually unless absolutely necessary.
Previous Next

title: Examples
html:
App Examples


There is an example for each type of setup. You can copy and paste for a quick live app.
type: Contents then List of Child Root Documents

title: Start and Events
html:
Start SimpleDocs and attach to Events

SimpleDocs makes 5 Events available for you to work with.

  • init
  • keystone
  • model
  • routes
  • complete


There are three ways to use SimpleDocs

  • Keystone App
  • Express App
  • Standalone App


Include Modules

A Keystone App 
var keystone = require('keystone'),
    simpledocs = require('simpledocs');
An Express App 
var express = require('express'),
    mongoose = require('mongoose'),
    app = express(),
    simpledocs = require('simpledocs');
A Standalone App only requires SimpleDocs 
var simpledocs = require('simpledocs');

Create init Object or use simpledocs.set

The init Object will be used later to start 
simpledocs.set('route','/docs/simpledocs');

/* or */

var init = {
    
    route: '/docs/simpledocs',

    /* set standalone to true for a complete app
     * only requires you to include SimpleDocs
     * */	
    standalone: false,

    /* For a current express setup pass app and mongoose
     * do not include or set false for a keystone or standalone app
     * */
    app:app,
    mongoose:mongoose,
    
    /* allow register and can admin are not available for express app
     * turn on to add the first user
     * */	
    'new user can admin':true,
    'allow register':true,
    
    /* port, mongo and ssl options are for standalone only
     * set to false to ignore or use defaults
     * */	
    'port': 12111,
    'ssl': false,
    //'ssl key': 'key.pem',
    //'ssl cert':'cert.pem',
    //'ssl port': 12222,
    'mongo': 'mongodb://localhost/simpledocs',

    'name': 'standalone documents',
    'brand': 'inquisive',
	
    'simpledocs model': 'simpledocs-documentation',
    'simpledocs model config': {
		label: 'SimpleDocs Documentation',
		path: 'simpledocs',
		singular: 'SimpleDocs Document',
		plural: 'SimpleDocs Documents',
    },
}

Attach to Events

For Express apps use the complete Event to signal when it is OK to start the http(s) server 
simpledocs
	.on('init',function(config) {
		/* we get the config object we pass to start */
		
	})
	.on('keystone',function(keystone) {
		/* add your own keystone options before mount 
                 * this event is not fired if you are mounting inside a current Keystone app
                 * for a standalone/express app you can add additional keystone routes here
                 * */
		//keystone.app.get('/route',function(req,res){});
	})
	.on('model',function(keystone) {
		/* add your own models and register them with keystone */
		
	})
	.on('routes',function(keystone) {
		/* add your own routes for a keystone app*/
		
	})
	.on('complete',function(keystone) {
		/* app is configured */
		//console.log('start app on port 12111');
		/*start app for express*/
		//app.listen(12111);
	});

Start our App

Keystone App 
keystone.start({
	onMount: function() {
                simpledocs.start(init);
        }
});

Express and Standalone App 
simpledocs.start(init);
** Express apps should work with the complete Event to start the Express app after SimpleDocs routes are added.
links: Keystone App Example, BYO Express Example, Standalone App Example

title: CSS and Theme
html:
Toggle Theme

Bootstrap is used for the styles.

By default SimpleDocs comes with a light and dark theme.


You can set the theme. The class will be appended to the body container 
simpledocs.set('theme','dark-theme');
Set false for the default light theme.

To switch themes during session click the snowman in the top right corner to open the share menu.

You can include a theme switcher in your documents... 

<a onclick="snowUI.toggleTheme()" style="cursor:pointer">switch themes</a>


The light theme (replaced by any custom theme) is always one of the toggle classes. We will use simpledocs.get('theme') || 'dark theme'; to determine which theme class to use as the other toggle.
markdown:
Custom Stylesheet

Add your own stylesheet. It will be called last and override any default styles. Provide a full url or a link to your app public folder.
You can combine both options to attach your own theme to the body class.

simpledocs.set('custom style','/styles/mystyles.css');

Here is a copy of the dark theme. It is just colors. You can use it as a template.

title: Link Helpers
html:
Add special links to your documents


Add the sdlink class to link to another document without a page reload. 
<a href="/docs/simpledocs/about" class="sdlink" >About</a>

<a href="license" class="sdlink" >License</a>
/docs/simpledocs/about | license
Absolute and relative links will function correctly during a Right-Click > Open Link in a New Tab event.

Theme Switcher - Try 
<a onclick="snowUI.toggleTheme()" style="cursor:pointer">switch themes</a>

title: Carousel
html:
Carousel Styling


You can attach the simpledoc class to a carousel widget to style it and control individual slides.

The indicators are above the content instead of hovering over.

The left and right controls have their widths set to 7% on desktop and 15% mobile. Background image state is set to hover only.

The caption defaults to 95px height and 100% width, aligned on the bottom. The inner text is 95% width and resides in the caption-text class.

Add the class top, left, left-top, right or right-top to the carousel-caption div to align in the requested position.

top mirrors bottom. left and right default to 0 aligned horizontally, 0 bottom alignment, 100% height and 200px wide. left-top and right-top default to 0 aligned horizontally, 0 top alignment, 100% height and 200px wide.

Change the width or height by adding an available w(n) or h(n) class to the carousel-caption div.

Width
w20, w25, w30, w35, w40, w45, w50, w55, w60, w65, w70, w75, w80, w85, w90, w95 equal percent
w025, w050, w075, w100, w200, w250, w300, w400, w500 equal pixels

Height
h20, h25, h30, h35, h40, h45, h50, h55, h60, h65, h70, h75, h80, h85, h90, h95 equal percent
h025, h059, h075, h100, h200, h250, h300, h400, h500 equal pixels

Example 

<div id="carousel-example-generic" class="carousel slide simpledoc" data-ride="carousel" data-interval="false">
	<ol class="carousel-indicators">
		<li data-target="#carousel-example-generic" data-slide-to="0" class="active"></li>
		<li data-target="#carousel-example-generic" data-slide-to="1"></li>
		<li data-target="#carousel-example-generic" data-slide-to="2"></li>
	</ol>
	<!-- Wrapper for slides -->
	<div class="carousel-inner" role="listbox">
		<div class="item active">
			<img src="https://inquisive.link/images/docs/snowcoins/windows/node_download.png" /> 
			<div class="carousel-caption h75"> 
				<div class="caption-text"> 
					Visit the <a href="http://nodejs.org/download/" target="_blank">Node.js Download</a> page and select the installer for your computer. <br />
				</div>
			</div> 
		</div> 

		<div class="item ">
			<img src="https://inquisive.link/images/docs/snowcoins/windows/open_node_installer.png" />
			<div class="carousel-caption "> 
				<div class="caption-text"> <b>
					Start Node.js Installer</b> - When your download completes click the file to run it. 
				</div> 
			</div> 
		</div> 
		<div class="item"> 
			<img src="https://inquisive.link/images/docs/snowcoins/windows/node_step1.png" /> 
			<div class="carousel-caption right h80 w40"> 
				<div class="caption-text"> <b>
					Install Step 1</b> <br /><br />Click Next to start 
				</div> 
			</div> 
		</div>

	</div>
	<!-- Controls -->
	<a class="left carousel-control" href="#carousel-example-generic" role="button" data-slide="prev">
		<span class="glyphicon glyphicon-chevron-left"></span>
		<span class="sr-only">Previous</span>
	</a>
	<a class="right carousel-control" href="#carousel-example-generic" role="button" data-slide="next">
		<span class="glyphicon glyphicon-chevron-right"></span>
		<span class="sr-only">Next</span>
	</a>
</div>

Raw CSS 

#carousel-example-generic {
	max-width: 940px;
	margin:0 auto;
}
.simpledoc #carousel-example-generic a {
	color: #B3E3FB;
}
.simpledoc .carousel-indicators {
	bottom: initial;
	position:relative;
	top:initial;
	width:auto;
	margin-left: initial;
	left:initial;
	border-color:#070F13;
}
.simpledoc .carousel-indicators li{
	border-color:#070F13;
}
.simpledoc .carousel-indicators .active {
	background-color:#070F13;
}
.simpledoc .carousel-control {
	width:8%;

}
.simpledoc .carousel-control.right {
	right: 0;
	left: auto;
	background-image: none;
	filter:none;
	background-repeat: repeat-x;
}
.simpledoc .carousel-control.left {
	background-image: none;
	filter:none;
	background-repeat: repeat-x;
}
.simpledoc .carousel-control.left:hover {
	background-image: -webkit-linear-gradient(left,rgba(0,0,0,.5) 0,rgba(0,0,0,.0001) 100%);
	background-image: -o-linear-gradient(left,rgba(0,0,0,.5) 0,rgba(0,0,0,.0001) 100%);
	background-image: -webkit-gradient(linear,left top,right top,from(rgba(0,0,0,.5)),to(rgba(0,0,0,.0001)));
	background-image: linear-gradient(to right,rgba(0,0,0,.5) 0,rgba(0,0,0,.0001) 100%);
	filter: progid:DXImageTransform.Microsoft.gradient(startColorstr='#80000000', endColorstr='#00000000', GradientType=1);
	background-repeat: repeat-x;
}
.simpledoc .carousel-control.right:hover {
	right: 0;
	left: auto;
	background-image: -webkit-linear-gradient(left,rgba(0,0,0,.0001) 0,rgba(0,0,0,.5) 100%);
	background-image: -o-linear-gradient(left,rgba(0,0,0,.0001) 0,rgba(0,0,0,.5) 100%);
	background-image: -webkit-gradient(linear,left top,right top,from(rgba(0,0,0,.0001)),to(rgba(0,0,0,.5)));
	background-image: linear-gradient(to right,rgba(0,0,0,.0001) 0,rgba(0,0,0,.5) 100%);
	filter: progid:DXImageTransform.Microsoft.gradient(startColorstr='#00000000', endColorstr='#80000000', GradientType=1);
	background-repeat: repeat-x;
}
.simpledoc .carousel-caption {
	height:95px;
	left:0%;
	right:0%;
	bottom:0;
	color:#FFFCEF;
	text-shadow:none;
}
.simpledoc .carousel-caption.right {
	height:100%;
	left:initial;
	right:0;
	bottom:0;
	color:#FFFCEF;
	width:200px;
	height:100%;
	text-shadow:none;
}
.simpledoc .carousel-caption.right-top {
	height:100%;
	left:initial;
	right:0;
	bottom:initial;
	top:0;
	color:#FFFCEF;
	width:200px;
	height:100%;
	text-shadow:none;
}

	height:100%;
	left:0;

}
.simpledoc .carousel-caption.left-top {
	height:100%;

	bottom:intial;
	top:0;
	color:#FFFCEF;
	width:200px;
	height:100%;
	text-shadow:none;
}
.simpledoc .carousel-caption.top {
	height:95px;
	left:0%;

	color:#FFFCEF;
	text-shadow:none;
}
